title: Roy Tang
description: Roy Tang's blog. Programmer, engineer, scientist, critic, gamer, dreamer, and kid-at-heart. Randomly amazed.

items.content_html: @mtgsalivanth you’re an american right? is there a country where public schools ARE good?
items.summary: @mtgsalivanth you’re an american right? is there a country where public schools ARE good?

items.content_html: @habeo that’s because most people here go through a terrible primary/secondary school system, so they need college to make up for it
items.summary: @habeo that’s because most people here go through a terrible primary/secondary school system, so they need college to make up for it

items.content_html: @habeo the betterment of society as a whole @roytang I know. shouldn’t we therefore think about alternative approaches? Cramming them through school is not necessarily to their benefit
items.summary: @habeo the betterment of society as a whole @roytang I know. shouldn’t we therefore think about alternative approaches? Cramming them through school is not necessarily to their benefit

items.content_html: @habeo so it’s ok for us to have a number of ppl graduating from school with a lower level of education than what their diploma implies?
items.summary: @habeo so it’s ok for us to have a number of ppl graduating from school with a lower level of education than what their diploma implies?

items.content_html: Which is better: free low quality (classroom shortages, overworked teachers, etc) education 4 all or higher-quality education 4 select few?
